title: Electric Fields - Constant field between plates

content.description: A parallel-plate capacitor is charged so that a uniform electric field with magnitude <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"> <mi>E</mi> </math> is created between the plates. A test charge with charge <math alttext="positive q" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></math> is placed halfway between the plates, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The force exerted on the test charge by the electric field has magnitude <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math>. The test charge is then moved half the distance to the negatively charged plate, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
content.question: What is the magnitude of the force exerted by the electric field on the test charge at the position shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> </math>?
